intro: Boehmeria wightiana, commonly known as the Indian nettle or hill cotton, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Urticaceae. It is native to the Himalayas and parts of Southeast Asia, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and small, greenish-white flowers that grow in clusters. Its fibers are used in traditional textiles and papermaking due to their strength and durability. Boehmeria wightiana is also valued for its medicinal properties in some traditional systems of medicine.
